content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Extraction System at position (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction system burner inserter at position (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)

### Copper Cable Factory at position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at position (2.5, 17.5)
– Dedicated factory burner inserter at position (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT
– Associated assembling machine at position (1.5, 19.5) as indicated by nearby connectivity

### Belt Depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden chest placed as the belt depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
– Dedicated transport belt segment adjacent at position (4.5, 15.5)
– Dedicated depot burner inserter at position (3.5, 14.5) with pickup position (3.5, 15.5) and drop position (3.5, 13.5)

ERROR TIPS

– When connecting transport belts, do not target a Prototype.SteamEngine directly. Always insert an intermediary inserter so that the belt connects to the inserter rather than the steam engine.
– For placement errors due to distance, ensure you move within the maximum allowed range (e.g., move closer to the target position before placing a wooden chest).
– Before placement, verify the inventory has the required item (e.g., a wooden chest) to avoid shortages during entity placement.
– Check for correct variable naming (for example, ensure that the target entity is properly referenced rather than using an undefined name such as “target_chest”) to prevent NameError exceptions.
